description:
1. Send a REBUILD API request
2. Immediately send another request to REBOOT instance.

Expected Behavior: 
Reboot request should fail 

Actual Behavior: 
1. Reboot request returns HTTP/1.1 202 Accepted, however the instance fails to reboot and Shuts off
2. Lot of Uncaught Exceptions in nova-compute.log

nova-compute log: http://paste.openstack.org/show/2395/
Nova and EC2 instance state : http://paste.openstack.org/show/2396/

Diablo 4 Version: 2011.3-dev (2011.3-nova-milestone-tarball:tarmac-20110825234031-sqwfb0kwnj0aw26t)
title: Attempting to reboot an instance that is being rebuilt shuts off the instance.

comments.content:
1. Send a REBUILD API request
2. Immediately send another request to REBOOT instance.

Expected Behavior: 
Reboot request should fail 

Actual Behavior: 
1. Reboot request returns HTTP/1.1 202 Accepted, however the instance fails to reboot and Shuts off
2. Lot of Uncaught Exceptions in nova-compute.log

nova-compute log: http://paste.openstack.org/show/2395/
Nova and EC2 instance state : http://paste.openstack.org/show/2396/

Diablo 4 Version: 2011.3-dev (2011.3-nova-milestone-tarball:tarmac-20110825234031-sqwfb0kwnj0aw26t)
comments.author: https://api.launchpad.net/1.0/~rohitk

comments.content:
In my experience there are a bunch of issues like this - if you ask  Nova to do something that conflicts with current state, it won't say no, but will do it's best - no matter how silly that is :). 

It would definitely be nice to have have this caught in a more intelligent fashion.
comments.author: https://api.launchpad.net/1.0/~gavin-brebner-orange

comments.content:
This has been fixed. Here's the output I get when I reboot while rebuilding:

Cannot 'reboot' while instance is in vm_state rebuilding (HTTP 409)
